Package chess

Class Utility

java.lang.Object
chess.Utility
public class Utility
extends java.lang.Object
Holds the utility methods for the Chess class
Author:
Ibrahim Khajanchi, Karl Sequeira

  • Constructor Details

    • Utility

      public Utility()

  • Method Details

    • getRowCol

      public static int[] getRowCol​(java.lang.String block)
      This method takes in the user input from command line and returns row and column to be used for the chess-board
      Parameters:
      block - string form of user input
      Returns:
      the row and column of the input in integer form

    • handleIllegalCheck

      public static boolean handleIllegalCheck​(int[] source_coordinates, int[] dest_coordinates, ChessPiece source_piece, ChessPiece dest_piece, int[] king_coordinates, King king, Board chessBoard, boolean whiteMove)
      This method handles the case when the player makes a move that puts their king in check
      Parameters:
      source_coordinates - the coordinates of the piece you want to move
      dest_coordinates - the coordinates of the spot you want to move to
      source_piece - the piece you want to move
      dest_piece - the piece at the destination you want to move to
      king_coordinates - the coordinates of the king
      king - the king piece
      chessBoard - the board object
      whiteMove - who's turn is it, white or black?
      Returns:
      the boolean that tells you whose turn it is

    • handleLegalCheck

      public static boolean handleLegalCheck​(int[] king_coordinates, int[] threat_coordinates, King king, Board chessBoard, java.lang.Boolean game)
      This method checks if the check is a check-mate
      Parameters:
      king_coordinates - the coordinates of the king
      threat_coordinates - the coordinates of the piece that's putting the king in check
      king - the king piece
      chessBoard - the board object
      game - whether the game is still being played or not
      Returns:
      the boolean game which tells you if game is over or not
